dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Snoeks, J., Laleye, P. & Contreras-MacBeath, T. 2009. Alestopetersius smykalai. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: This species is endemic to western Africa. It has only been collected from the Niger delta.

agents.full_name: Snoeks, J., Laleye, P. & Contreras-MacBeath, T.
Snoeks, J., Laleye, P. & Contreras-MacBeath, T.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Diagnosis: 5.5-6.5 scales above lateral line; lateral line complete; 25-26 lateral line scales; 18-19 branched rays of anal fin; 16 gill rakers on lower limb of first gill arch (Ref. 2880, 81279). Description: snout blunt, weakly prominent; mandible with single row of 9 or 10 external teeth; anal fin with 3 unbranched and 18-19 branched rays (Ref. 2880, 81279). Big eyes (Ref. 2880). Coloration: silvery body with fine black lateral stripe ending in caudal peduncle spot; very light humeral spot also present (Ref. 2880, 81279).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: pelagic; freshwater; pH range: 6.0 - 7.2; dH range: 8 - 15

dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Snoeks, J., Laleye, P. & Contreras-MacBeath, T. 2009. Alestopetersius smykalai. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
VU
Vulnerable

Red List Criteria
A2ce

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2009

Assessor/s
Snoeks, J., Laleye, P. & Contreras-MacBeath, T.

Reviewer/s
Collen, B., Darwall, W., Ram, M. & Smith, K. (SRLI Freshwater Fish Evaluation Workshop)

Contributor/s

Justification
Assessed as Vulnerable due to an inferred decline of greater than 30% over the past fifteen years. This is due to habitat degradation, water pollution and introduced species within the lower Niger River basin.
